definition: Yunnan and Guizhou plateau in southwest China, covering east Yunnan, whole of Guizhou, west of Guangxi and southern margins of Sichuan, Hubei and Hunan
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]

sentences.english: Type C is Yunnan and Guizhou plateau.
The natural environment and natural resources of Yun-Gui plateau has their own features.
sentences.chinese: 云贵高原的自然环境与自然资源有其特点。

sentences.english: Baise prefecture is situated in east of Yun_Gui plateau and the part area is high mountainous.
sentences.chinese: 百色地区地处云贵高原东部，部分地形是高山大岭。

sentences.english: Located in the Yunnan-Guizhou plateau, Kunming is a place with many geological hazards, such as the collapse, landslide and debris flow.
sentences.chinese: 昆明地处云贵高原，属崩滑流等地质灾害多发地区。

definition: Hengduan mountains, several parallel mountain ranges on the border between west Yunnan and Sichuan and east Tibet
karst landform (weathered limestone, often forming caves)

Three Parallel Rivers National Park, in mountainous northwest Yunnan World Heritage protected area: the three rivers are Nujian 怒江 or Salween, Jinsha 金沙江 or upper reaches of Changjiang and Lancang 澜沧江 or Mekong
the Grand Canyon of the Nujiang river in Tibet and Yunnan
the roof of the world/usually refers to Tibet or Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau 青藏高原[Qing1 Zang4 gao1 yuan2]
Nujiang river of south Tibet and northwest Yunnan, the upper reaches of Salween river 薩爾溫江|萨尔温江, forming border of Myanmar and Thailand
Yuecheng mountain range between south Hunan and Guangxi

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4
